title: Roast pork with celeriac purée and garlicky mushrooms

ingredients.item: 1.2kg essential Waitrose British pork leg joint
½ x 20g pack flat leaf parsley, chopped
1 celeriac (about 900g), peeled and chopped into 3cm cubes
1 tbsp essential Waitrose half fat crème fraîche

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to its highest setting. Place the pork in a roasting dish. Dry it with kitchen paper, go over the scored lines of the skin with a sharp knife, then rub the salt into the scores. Mix the sage and lemon zest with half the oil; rub into the flesh. Roast for 25 minutes, then turn down the oven to 180°C, gas mark 4 and roast for 55 minutes (or 25 minutes per 500g). Remove from the oven and rest for 10-15 minutes.

Meanwhile, make the purée. Heat the butter in a saucepan, then, when foaming, add the onions and garlic; cover and soften for 5 minutes. Add the celeriac and cook, covered, for another 5 minutes, then add the milk, cover and simmer gently for 20 minutes until the celeriac is soft. Transfer to a blender or food processor, season and blitz until smooth. Return to the pan and stir in the nutmeg and crème fraîche. Reheat gently before serving.
Heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat. Add the crushed garlic and sliced mushrooms, and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring regularly. Season and toss with the parsley.
Slice the meat and serve with the celeriac purée and mushrooms, plus any juices from the roasting pan.
